sen.j: 覚助（かくじょ、長和2年（1013年）- 康平6年11月11日 (旧暦)（1063年12月3日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Kakujo (1013-December 3, 1063) was a Buddhist priest of the Tendai-shu sect who lived in the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 父は左京大夫藤原道雅。
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Michimasa who was the Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices).

sen.j: 園城寺（三井寺）で行円・心誉に師事して密教を学び、花王院に住した。
sen.e: Kakujo studied at the Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) about Esoteric Buddhism under Gyoen and Shinyo while he dwelled at Kao-in Temple.

sen.j: 大納言源経長の妻の病気平癒を祈願して霊験があったとされた。
sen.e: It is said that he prayed for curing the illness of the wife of MINAMOTO no Tsunenaga the chief councillor of state and got a miracle.

sen.e: Also it is said that he let a cold mineral spring outwell at the Kao-in Temple, and people called it "Hosenbo."
